sentence.Network_en: Channel 4's overseas buyers have foreseen the audience demand with their usual perspicacity.
sentence.Network_cn: 四频道的海外收购者以其惯有的洞察力预见到了观众的需求。

sentence.Network_en: Perspicacity includes selective code, selective comparing and selective combining.
sentence.Network_cn: 洞察力包括选择性编码 、 选择性比较、选择性联合.

sentence.Network_en: He may own the perspicacity and persistence to catch and keep the most valuable thing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他可能拥有洞察力和坚忍力,可以抓住和保有人生中最宝贵的东西.

entry.def: Someone who is perspicacious notices, realizes, and understands things quickly.

example.ex: ...one of the most perspicacious and perceptive historians of that period.
example.tran: 那个时期最敏锐、最有洞察力的历史学家之一

means.word_mean: 1. intelligence manifested by being astute (as in business dealings)
2. the capacity to assess situations or circumstances shrewdly and to draw sound conclusions

auth_sentence.content: Norman had acquired his reputation for economic and financial perspicacity because he had been so right on so many things.
auth_sentence.res_content: Norman had acquired his reputation for economic and financial perspicacity because he had been so right on so many things.
